intro: Silene behen var. almolae, commonly known as the Almolá silene, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is native to the Andean region of South America, specifically Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its simple, erect stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
